meanings.definition: To punish by dragging under the keel of a ship.
meanings.sent1: The pirate was keelhauled for his disobedience.
meanings.sent2: The captain threatened to keelhaul the sailor if he disobeyed orders.
meanings.sent3: The crew joked that the only way to teach the mischievous parrot a lesson was to keelhaul it.
meanings.sent4: The idea of being keelhauled through rough waters was a terrifying prospect for the crew.
meanings.sent5: The legend of the pirate captain who keelhauled his entire crew spread fear among sailors.

meanings.sent1: The teacher keelhauled the student for cheating on the test.
meanings.sent2: The coach threatened to keelhaul the players if they didn't improve their performance.
meanings.sent3: The boss jokingly said he would keelhaul anyone caught slacking off at work.
meanings.sent4: The consequences of breaking the rules were so severe that it felt like being keelhauled.
meanings.sent5: The strict principal was known to keelhaul students who broke the school's code of conduct.
